awd_titl_txt: 1990 International Workshop on Defect and Fault Tolerance inVLSI Systems; Grenoble, France; November 5-7, 1990
awd_abstract_narration: The 1990 International Workshop on Defect and Fault-Tolerance in                VLSI Systems is the 4th in a series of meetings which started with              the workshop in "Designing for Yield" held in Oxford in 1987.  The              workshop is held outside the U.S. every third year.  The 1990                   meeting is being held in Grenoble, France.  It is co-sponsored by               the IEEE Technical Committees on Fault-Tolerant Computing and on                VLSI and by the IFIP Working Group 10.5.  The meeting is an                     important forum for the dissemination of experimental data and                  analytical techniques for defect/fault control and tolerance for                the manufacture and design of VLSI/WSI systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
